result.execSummary:
The defendant Mya R. Bird was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions:  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programs or education required by the agent.  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete anger management.  Pay costs.  Defendant to be afford expungement per 973.015 upon successful completion of probation (and must follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding that procedure when the time comes).

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Mya R. Bird
Current: 427 N Church St, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 01-26-2017)
Prior: 483 N. Main Street #204, Richland Center, WI 53581

Defendant Mya R. Bird in court with attorney Michael Yang. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Y states def will plead to disorderly conduct for dismissal/read-in of battery; recommended sentence is 1 year probation with conditions of anger management assessment and treatment; parties jointly request expungement upon successful completion of probation.  Def pleads no contest to dc.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence withheld for 1 year probation with conditions that def attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programs or education required by the agent; attend, pay for, and successfully complete anger management; pay costs; expungement per 973.015 upon successful completion of probation.  Battery count dismissed/read-in.
Status conference on November 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mya R. Bird not in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael Yang appeared by phone means for Defendant Mya R. Bird.  Atty. Yang requests further status - plea/sentencing possible at next date, 11/3 at 9.
Letter from Atty Michael Yang requesting to appear by phone
to Appear
Status conference on August 24, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Mya R. Bird in court with attorney Michael Yang. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Yang enters NG pleas on def's behalf.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 29, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
verbal request from Atty. Yang to move the 6/29 AIA from 10 a.m. to 3:30
Adjourned initial appearance on June 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mya R. Bird in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Lisa McDougal appears via phone, states def. does qualify for SPD.  Court states charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as her rights including right to counsel. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
